name: inject fake values
Check Dirs, Create Dirs & Set Globals
uci show network.lan
func:
var reply = `network.lan=interface
network.lan.ifname='eth0'
network.lan.proto='static'
network.lan.netmask='255.255.255.0'
network.lan.ip6assign='60'
network.lan.ipaddr='192.168.10.211'
network.lan.gateway='192.168.10.1'
network.lan.dns='208.67.220.222'`

// msg.payload = reply;
msg.payload = "uci show network.lan"
return msg;

name: uci show wireless
func:
var reply = `wireless.@wifi-iface[0]=wifi-iface
wireless.@wifi-iface[0].device='wlan0'
wireless.@wifi-iface[0].mode='ap'
wireless.@wifi-iface[0].key='MyPASSWORD'
wireless.@wifi-iface[0].encryption='psk2'
wireless.@wifi-iface[0].network='WIFI'
wireless.@wifi-iface[0].disassoc_low_ack='0'
wireless.@wifi-iface[0].ssid='Intellidesign.FP2.114'`

// msg.payload = reply;
msg.payload = "uci show wireless"

return msg;

name: uci show network.ppp0
parse lan response
parse WIFI response
parse ppp0
uci set network.lan
func:
var set_string = `uci set network.lan.netmask='`+ msg.payload.eth.netmask+`'
uci set network.lan.ipaddr='`+ msg.payload.eth.ipaddr+`'
uci set network.lan.gateway='`+ msg.payload.eth.gateway+`'
uci set network.lan.dns='`+ msg.payload.eth.dns+`'
uci commit network
luci-reload
/etc/init.d/network restart
`

msg.payload = set_string;
return msg;

name: uci set wireless.@wifi-iface[0]
func:
var set_string = `uci set wireless.@wifi-iface[0].mode='ap'
uci set wireless.@wifi-iface[0].key='`+ msg.payload.wifi.key+`'
uci set wireless.@wifi-iface[0].ssid='`+ msg.payload.wifi.ssid+`'
uci commit wireless
luci-reload
/etc/init.d/network restart
`


msg.payload = set_string;
return msg;

name: uci set network.ppp0
func:
var username = msg.payload.cell.username ? msg.payload.cell.username : '';
var password = msg.payload.cell.password ? msg.payload.cell.password : '';

var set_string = `ubus call network.interface.ppp0 down
network.ppp0.device='/dev/ttyACM2'
uci set network.ppp0.apn='`+ msg.payload.cell.apn +`'
uci set network.ppp0.username='`+ username +`'
uci set network.ppp0.password='`+ password +`'
uci set network.ppp0.dialnumber='*99#'
uci commit
luci-reload
/etc/init.d/network restart
`

msg.payload = set_string;
return msg;

(max-width:46.1875em){.editor-header{display:none}.editor-header--first{display:block;width:100%}}</style></head><body id="preview">
<h2><a id="Module_Setting_0"></a>Module Setting</h2>
<p>Configuration is divided into 2 sections.</p>
<ul>
<li>App Setting</li>
<li>Destination Settings</li>
</ul>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note:</strong> <em><strong>Submit</strong></em> button is enabled, only when required fields are configured</p>
</blockquote>
<h3><a id="App_Setting_8"></a>App Setting</h3>
<p>Here you can configure local data directory, where <strong>VMS</strong> will be uploading files and application timing. These should be left as a default as it does provide optimal setting. If you are not sure, what to change, please do not change anything.</p>
<ul>
<li>Data Directory:
<ul>
<li>Directory on the unit (local unit/router), where files will be uploaded</li>
<li>Directory needs to be configured as an absolute path and trailing <code>/</code> is required</li>
<li>Default: <code>/mnt/sdcard/data/</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>File Retention:
<ul>
<li>Configure how many days unit should keep files before, they will be deleted. All files older than this setting will be deleted from the unit, irrespective, if they have been uploaded</li>
<li>Default: 7 days</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Check FTP Alive:
<ul>
<li>Time interval, between application check, what FTP servers, from configured are online (available for file upload). This interval is restarted after application upload/try to upload files to remote server.</li>
<li><em>Example</em>: FTP - 1 upload takes 120 seconds and there are no additional FTP server configured. Application will start next FTP server check after 120seconds + configured delay(default: 60 seconds).</li>
<li>Default: 60 seconds</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Check Data Folder:
<ul>
<li>Interval in which application check upload folder (<em>Data Directory</em>) for new files and prepare them for configured FTP servers</li>
<li>Default: 10 minutes</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>File Retention Handler
<ul>
<li>Interval in which application search files, which are older than <em>File Retention</em></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h3><a id="Destination_Settings_27"></a>Destination Settings</h3>
<p>Here you can configure up to 10 FTP server destinations. Select FTP server from from drop down menu and current configuration will populate configuration fields. If FTP server has not been configured, no values will be shown.</p>
<ul>
<li>IP Address:
<ul>
<li>IP Address of the remote FTP server</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Username:
<ul>
<li>Username, which will be used to authenticate with particular FTP server</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Password:
<ul>
<li>Password, which will be used to authenticate with particular FTP server</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Directory:
<ul>
<li>Remote directory on the FTP server, where account has write access permission</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Compress:
<ul>
<li>If compression of files before transition is required. <em>tar/gzip</em> compression is used</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

</body></html>
